intro: Utricularia spiralis var. pobeguinii, commonly known as the spiral bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, spirally arranged leaves that form a rosette structure. The plant produces tiny, bladder-like traps that capture and digest small aquatic organisms. It thrives in nutrient-poor, freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its unique morphology and carnivorous adaptation make it an intriguing subject for botanical study.
